content.question: A heavy, uniform rope hangs from a ceiling and is not long enough to touch the floor. Which of the following best compares the magnitude of the tension force in the middle of the rope, <math alttext="F sub middle" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>mid </mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, to the magnitude of the tension at the top of the rope near the ceiling, <math alttext="F sub top" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>top </mtext></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub middle, equals 2 F sub top" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>mid </mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>top </mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub middle equals F sub top" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>mid </mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>top </mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub middle, equals the fraction with numerator F sub top, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>mid </mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>top </mtext></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub middle, equals the fraction with numerator F sub top, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>mid </mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>top </mtext></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub middle, equals the fraction with numerator F sub top, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>mid </mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>top </mtext></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>
